intro: Endotropis oleifera, commonly known as the African oil tree, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves with long, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody pods containing oily seeds. The seeds are rich in oils and are used in traditional medicine and as a source of biofuel. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna ecosystems.
